description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Jack wanted to catch 50 tons of fish, and caught 17 tons.

The group of fishermen discussed their recent fishing trips and shared their catches, with Emma surprising everyone by catching the most fish, and they exchanged ideas on what might have contributed to their success and how they can improve their catch next month.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly fishing report. John caught 18 tons of fish. Kate caught 21 tons of fish. Jack caught 17 tons of fish. Emma caught 25 tons of fish. Luke caught 19 tons of fish.
John

Wow, looks like we all had a pretty good haul this month! I'm a little surprised by how much Emma caught, though - did anyone notice anything unusual about her fishing spot? Maybe we can all learn from her success.
Kate

Hey John, I'm a bit surprised by how little you caught this month, considering how much you usually catch. Did you notice anything different about the fishing conditions this time around? Maybe we can all learn from each other's experiences and strategies.
Emma

Hey guys, I'm a bit surprised by how much I caught this month, but I think I might have an idea why. I noticed that there were a lot more fish swimming near the surface of the water this month, and I think that might have made it easier for me to catch them. Maybe we can all try fishing in different spots next month to see if we can find more of those surface-swimming fish.
John
